Subjects: John, duke of Bedford; occasional verse; princes, advice to; advice, to princes
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, Presentation verses to the Duke of Bedford, Regent of France, with a copy of the De Regimine Principum — three 9-line stanzas

BLRoy17Dxviii.First Lines:
Un to the rial egles excellenceI humble Clerk with hertes
                    lowlynesse…
BLRoy17Dxviii.Last Lines:
Of his tresor nat de[ ]eth his nobleyeDele with non so ig[ ]ant as
                    me
BLRoy17Dxviii.Note:
Damage to last few folios due to stain, immediately follows Regiment
                        of Princes (3581).
                    Holograph manuscript; ends, ‘Cest tout’.
BLRoy17Dxviii.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 92-3.

HunHM111.First Lines:
Un to the rial egles excellenceI humble Clerc with al hertes
                    humblesse…
HunHM111.Last Lines:
…Of his tresor nat deyneth hir nobleyeDele with noon so
                    ignorant as me
HunHM111.Attributed Title:
Ce feust mys en le liure de monseigneur Iohan lors nommez ore Regent de
                        ffrance & Duc de Bedford (f. 37v)
